</datafield>   <datafield tag="650" ind1="1" ind2="7">     <subfield code="a">cc-zero</subfield>     <subfield code="2">opendefinition.org</subfield>   </datafield>   <datafield tag="500" ind1=" " ind2=" ">     <subfield code="a">Summary: Unlike patents or community law in this matter, the Swiss copyrights legislation doesn\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdt provide the searchers with any particular advantage. Hence using protected works or services for research use only gives right to a privileged treatment when it\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds for private purpose, meaning personal or within a firm. In many respects, this special dispensation seems too restrictive. It should be wise to complete it with an exception granting access to protected works or services and the freedom to use them for scientific research matters. Such privileges could take the shape of a legal license or of an obligation to collective anagement.</subfield>   </datafield>   <datafield tag="100" ind1=" " ind2=" ">     <subfield code="u">Advocomplex</subfield>     <subfield code="a">Egloff, Willi</subfield>   </datafield> </record> </collection>
